intro: Adenocalymma macranthum, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its wood is highly valued for its durability and rich color, though it is now protected due to overharvesting. Adenocalymma macranthum plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
